3.2

13

No Violation. The execution, delivery and performance by each Project Company of each Investment Document and Principal Project Document to which it is a party and the consummation of the transactions contemplated thereunder, do not and will not: (a) violate or conflict with any provision of the certificate of formation or operating agreement of such Project Company; (b) assuming all Governmental Approvals necessary for the ownership and operation of the Facility are received in a timely manner, violate any provision or requirement of any federal, state or local law, statute, judgment, order, writ, injunction, decree, award, rule or regulation of any Governmental Authority applicable to such Project Company (other than Environmental Laws, which are addressed exclusively in Section 3.15 below and energy regulatory laws, which are dealt with exclusively by Section 3.19) to the extent that such violation would reasonably be expected to result in a Material Adverse Effect on any Project Company or the Facility; (c) violate in any material respect, result in a breach of, constitute (with due notice or lapse of time or both) a default of or cause any obligation, penalty, premium or right of termination to arise or accrue under, any Investment Document or Principal Project Document to which such Project Company is a party; or (d) result in the creation or imposition of any Encumbrance on the Assets of any Project Company other than Permitted Encumbrances or Permitted Equity Encumbrances upon any of the Assets of such Project Company.

3.3

3.4

Subsidiaries; Non-Related Liabilities. Immediately prior to the Execution Date, the Class B Member directly owns one hundred percent (100%) of the Membership Interests of the Holding Company, free and clear of all Encumbrances other than Permitted Equity Encumbrances. As of each Funding Date, the Class B Member directly owns one hundred percent (100%) of the Membership Interests of the Holding Company other than the Membership Interests of the Holding Company acquired by the Investors on the Execution Date, free and clear of all Encumbrances other than Permitted Equity Encumbrances. As of each Funding Date, the Holding Company directly owns one hundred percent (100%) of the Membership Interests of the Project Companies, free and clear of all Encumbrances other than Permitted Equity Encumbrances and Encumbrances created under the Financing Documents. No Project Company has, or has ever had, any Assets or any liabilities which do not arise in connection with the Project Companies’ interest in the Facility or the Holding Company’s Membership Interest in the Project Companies. Other than the Holding Company’s interest in the Project Companies, no Project Company has, or has ever had, any subsidiaries.

3.5 Members of the Holding Company; Additional Membership Interests. Immediately prior to the execution and delivery of this Agreement and the Operating Agreement, the Class B Member is the sole member of the Holding Company and there have never been any other members or owners of the Holding Company. Upon execution and delivery of the Operating Agreement, the Class B Member and the Investors shall hold the respective membership interests in the Holding Company as set forth in the Operating Agreement and said interests shall constitute all of the membership interests in the Holding Company. Other than as set forth in this Agreement and the Operating Agreement, none of the Holding Company or the Class B Member have any contract, arrangement or commitment to issue or sell any of its membership or partnership interest or any other interest in any Project Company or the Facility or any securities or obligations convertible into or exchangeable for, or giving any Person any right to acquire from it, any of its membership or partnership interest or any other interest in any Project Company or the Facility and no such securities or obligations are issued or outstanding other than as contemplated by this Agreement, the Operating Agreement and the Financing Facilities Documents. Upon execution and delivery

14

of the Operating Agreement, the Class A Units will be validly issued and duly authorized and upon payment to the Holding Company of the Investors Execution Date Contribution on the Execution Date, the Investors will have good title to the Class A Units free and clear of all Encumbrances other than Permitted Equity Encumbrances.

3.6 Warranty of Title; Personal Property. Each of the Fairfield Project Company and Hanford Project Company is the sole owner of the Fairfield Facility and the Hanford Facility (respectively) and each Project Company has good and valid title to the applicable Facility and all of the Project Companies’ Assets free and clear of all Encumbrances except Permitted Encumbrances.

3.7

Facility; Governmental Approvals. As of each Funding Date, each Project Company has obtained all Governmental Approvals then necessary for the ownership, installation, financing and operation of the Facility it owns in compliance with Applicable Law. Each such Governmental Approval is, as of the applicable Funding Date, validly issued, final and in full force and effect and is not subject to any current legal proceeding or to any unsatisfied condition which is reasonably likely to have a Material Adverse Effect on any Project Company or its Facility and all applicable appeal periods with respect thereto have expired. Each Project Company is in compliance in all material respects with all applicable Governmental Approvals and no Project Company has received written notice from a Governmental Authority of an actual or potential violation of any Governmental Approval that could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect on any Project Company or the Facility.

3.8

Employees. None of the Project Companies has, or has had since the date of its

creation, any employees or any Plan.

3.9

Brokers. No broker, finder, investment banker or other Person is entitled to any brokerage, finder’s or other fee or commission in connection with the transactions contemplated hereunder based upon arrangements made by or on behalf of any Project Company for which any Project Company or Investor will be responsible.

3.10 Consents and Approvals. Each Project Company has obtained all third-party consents and approvals required to be obtained by it as a condition to or in connection with the transactions contemplated under the Investment Documents, and each such consent and approval is in full force and effect.

3.11 Compliance with Applicable Law. Each of the Project Entities, the business and operations of the Project Entities and the development and construction of the Facility are and have been conducted in all respects in compliance with all Applicable Laws (other than Environmental Laws, which are addressed in Section 3.15 below), except to the extent such non-compliance could not reasonably be expected to result in a Material Adverse Effect on any Project Company or any Facility.

3.12 Litigation. There is no action, suit, claim, investigation or proceeding (including, but not limited to, any arbitration proceeding) of any nature pending or, to the Knowledge of the Class B Member, threatened (in writing) by or against any Project Company involving, affecting or relating to the transactions contemplated under any of the Investment Documents or Principal

15

Project Documents or any Project Company’s ability to complete the transactions contemplated thereunder, or involving the ownership or operation of the Facility, at law or in equity, or before or by any Governmental Authority or arbitral body that would be reasonably expected to result in a Material Adverse Effect on any Project Company or any Facility and no Project Company is subject to any order, writ, judgment, award, injunction or decree of any Governmental Authority or arbitral body involving, affecting or relating to the transactions contemplated hereunder or its ability to complete the transactions contemplated hereunder that would be reasonably expected to result in a Material Adverse Effect on any Project Company or any Facility.

ASSIGNMENT OF SYSTEM DOCUMENTS AND OTHER COLLATERAL (Hanford – Loan No. 400121300)

THIS ASSIGNMENT OF PROJECT DOCUMENTS AND OTHER COLLATERAL (“Assignment”) is made as of July 14, 2017, by BLUE SKY UTILITY 2017 II, LLC, a California limited liability company, having an office at 1129 Westview Drive, Napa, California 94558 (“Assignor”), for the benefit of NEW RESOURCE BANK, a California corporation, its successors, assigns and/or affiliates, having an office at 255 California Street, Suite 600, San Francisco, California 94111 (“Assignee”).

RECITALS:

Assignor and Assignee are parties to that certain Loan Agreement of even date herewith (the “Loan Agreement”), pursuant to which Lender has agreed to provide financing to Assignor in the maximum principal amount of up to TWO MILLION ONE HUNDRED SIXTY-FIVE THOUSAND AND NO/100THS DOLLARS ($2,165,000.00) (the “Loan”). All capitalized terms used and not otherwise defined herein shall have the meanings given to them in the Loan Agreement.

A.

B.

relating to the operation thereof.

It is a condition precedent to Assignee making the Loan that Assignor collaterally assign, transfer and set over to Assignee, all right, title and interest of Assignor in, to and under the System Documents, as additional security and collateral for the payment and performance by Assignor of the Loan and all of Assignor’s obligations under the Loan Documents.

C.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the recitals set forth above and incorporated herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, Assignor agrees as follows:

Assignor hereby collaterally grants, transfers and assigns to Assignee, all the right, title

1.2.

all other management, maintenance, service, supply or other agreements relating to the construction, use, operation and maintenance of the Project, and all warranties and guaranties issued in connection therewith;

advertise the Project;

1.10. all replacements, substitutions, additions and the proceeds of the foregoing,

together with any and all extensions, modifications, amendments, and renewals thereof.

The items referred to in Sections 1.1 through 1.10 above are sometimes hereinafter collectively referred to as the “System Documents”. The System Documents and all replacements, substitutions, additions and the proceeds thereof are collectively referred to in this Assignment as the “Collateral”.

This Assignment is given for the purpose of securing the payment of all sums, including, without limitation, the payment of principal and interest due under the Note, which are now or at any time due Assignee under the Loan Agreement or any other documents evidencing or securing the Loan, and any extensions, modifications, amendments and renewals thereof, and the performance and discharge of the obligations, covenants, conditions and agreements of Assignor contained herein and in the Loan Agreement and the other Loan Documents.

if at any time or times hereafter any representation or warranty made by Assignor herein proves to have been untrue or incorrect in any material respect when made, or thereafter becomes untrue or incorrect in any material respect and is not cured within the applicable grace period set forth in the Loan Agreement, if any; and

content.name: Site Lease
content.description: The Site Lease is a lease agreement granting rights to use the property at 1675 West Lacey Boulevard, Hanford, California, for the construction and operation of a 1,637 kW distributed solar system, serving as a critical component of the Project’s Collateral securing the Loan from New Resource Bank to Blue Sky Utility 2017 II, LLC. Functionally, it governs the use and occupancy of the Project site, is subject to Borrower covenants restricting material amendments without Lender consent, and its terms are integral to maintaining compliance and enabling Lender remedies upon default. Hierarchically, the Site Lease is assigned to the Lender as part of the security interest and is functionally dependent on the Borrower’s adherence to the Loan Agreement, underpinning the financing and operational framework of the solar energy system.

content.name: SITE LEASE
content.description: The Site Lease is a renewable energy generating system lease agreement that designates portions of the Project Site at 1675 West Lacey Boulevard, Hanford, California, for the installation and operation of a 1,637 kW distributed solar system. Originally executed on February 1, 2016, between the Host as Landlord and Blue Sky Utility LLC as Lessee, it was amended and assigned to Blue Sky Utility 2017 II, LLC (Borrower) and forms a critical component of the Collateral securing the Loan from New Resource Bank. Functionally, the Site Lease underpins the Project’s physical location rights, establishing a foundational relationship that enables the Borrower’s financing, construction, and operation obligations within the broader solar energy development and loan agreement framework.

content.name: California Distributed Renewable Generation Interconnection Community
content.summary: This community encompasses key entities involved in the interconnection, operation, and regulation of small-scale renewable electric generation facilities (primarily solar photovoltaic and wind systems of 1 MW or less) interconnected to California electric utility distribution systems, specifically Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) and Southern California Edison Company (SCE). It includes project owners, generating facilities, utility companies, regulatory authorities, and the formal application and interconnection frameworks that govern virtual net energy metering (NEMV) arrangements. The community operates within a complex regulatory and operational environment shaped by California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) decisions, utility tariffs, safety standards, and interconnection agreements, enabling distributed renewable energy integration and allocation of energy credits among multiple metered accounts at single service delivery points.

content.name: Blue Sky Utility LLC - Winery Square Station LP - Applicant Solar Energy Community
content.summary: This community centers on the interconnected entities involved in the development, ownership, operation, and utilization of solar photovoltaic electric generating facilities at the Winery Square shopping center in Fairfield, California, and related renewable energy projects in Hanford, California. Blue Sky Utility LLC acts as the primary service provider and asset manager, owning and operating solar facilities and administering virtual net metering programs (NEMV/VNMP) that allocate solar energy credits to tenants such as the Applicant. Winery Square Station LP is the property owner and licensor of rooftop space for solar installations, cooperating in program administration and retaining ownership of the building and utility meters. The Applicant is a tenant receiving solar energy credits and services under contractual agreements with Blue Sky Utility LLC and leasing premises from Winery Square Station LP. The community operates within a regulatory framework governed by California law and the California Public Utilities Commission, with financing and equity capital contributions structured through agreements involving multiple related entities.

results.completion:
The Site Lease for the Hanford project is a renewable energy generating system lease agreement that grants rights to use portions of the property at 1675 West Lacey Boulevard, Hanford, California, for the installation and operation of a 1,637 kW distributed solar system. It was originally executed on February 1, 2016, between the Host as Landlord and Blue Sky Utility LLC as Lessee, later amended and assigned to Blue Sky Utility 2017 II, LLC (Borrower). The Site Lease is a critical component of the collateral securing the loan from New Resource Bank and underpins the project’s physical location rights, establishing the foundational relationship that enables the Borrower’s financing, construction, and operation obligations within the broader solar energy development and loan agreement framework.
